product_name: LanolipsCoconutter 101 Ointment Multi-Balm - Dry Lips & Skin Treatment
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeLanolips took their iconic Original 101 Ointment and infused with vitamin E & coconut oil to create the Lips 101 Ointment Coconutter Multi-Balm. They call it *A little tube of magic* For extremely dry & chapped lips, skin patches, cuticles & elbows.
details: DetailsBenefitsThis super rich, 100% natural lip balm penetrates and seals in moisture to give extreme hydration for extremely dry and chapped lips.As its name suggests, it has many uses beyond just lips.101 Uses include: Apply to dry cuticles/cracked heels/dry nasal passages. Melt it into your own moisturizer to supercharge. Mix a tiny bit with your foundation for a natural, dewy look. Keep eyebrows in place. Apply to windburn/cold-chapped cheeks. Heal dry/brittle nails, paper cuts, insect bites.Alleviates dryness associated with psoriasis and eczema.FeaturesFemale-Owned Beauty BrandNew Mom Friendly - Safe enough for newborn babiesTSA-Approved, travel friendly beauty productDermatologically TestedCruelty-FreeCertified by Leaping BunnyVegetarian100% NaturalFormulated WithoutArtificial ColorsFragrancesParabensPthalatesPetrolatumPEGsMineral OilItem 2549506How To UseWarm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips & skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.IngredientsLanolin*, Aroma (Flavor)*, Tocopherol (Vit E)*, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut) Oil*. *Naturally Derived
how_to_use: Warm the ointment between the fingers or apply directly onto the lips & skin. Use generously.Precautions: For external use only.

reviews.headline: Yuck
reviews.comments: The cream is heavy and gunky, it left a nasty film on my lips, sadly I had to throw it away

reviews.headline: Great product!!!
reviews.comments: The Best lip protection ever!!!

reviews.headline: Just alright
reviews.comments:
I have so many lippies, and this one isn't a favorite. I rarely reach for it. The 101 Ointment Multi-Balm Coconutter is a super thick ointment that's a bit hard to spread on the lips. I usually scoop some out with a spatula or my finger, and once it warms up from my body heat, it applies more easily. It works well for maintaining already moisturized lips, but it's not the most effective in dry lip emergencies. 

The scent reminds me of an Australian coconut bronzing oil, kind of like suntan lotion. I do appreciate that it's made with 100% natural ingredients. I'll use it up so it doesn't go to waste, but I wouldn't rush to repurchase.

reviews.headline: Can't wait to try out their other lip products!
reviews.comments: Love the way it smells like coconuts and so hydrating without leaving a sticky feeling.

reviews.headline: So so
reviews.comments:
I have so many lippies, and this one isn't a favorite. I rarely reach for it. The 101 Ointment Multi-Balm Coconutter is a super thick ointment that's a bit hard to spread on the lips. I usually scoop some out with a spatula or my finger, and once it warms up from my body heat, it applies more easily. It works well for maintaining already moisturized lips, but it's not the most effective in dry lip emergencies. 

The scent reminds me of an Australian coconut bronzing oil, kind of like suntan lotion. I do appreciate that it's made with 100% natural ingredients. I'll use it up so it doesn't go to waste, but I wouldn't rush to repurchase.

reviews.headline: This is an amazing product!
reviews.comments: I would use this on my lips when they got really dry! They would be silky smooth is a matter of 2 days! I would also use it on my eczema patches and would work amazingly!

reviews.headline: All Time Go-to for Dry Lips
reviews.comments: The 101 Ointment in really any scent is the best lip product you can buy. Its incredibly moisturizing and thick, but not sticky. It lasts hours on end and always leaves my lips feeling genuinely norished rather than just soft. I have had chroniy dry lips since I was a kid and the only thing that's repaired them as well as the 101 Ointment has been literal neosporin. It's especially helpful in the winter as I live in a cold location. The only thing I will mention is that the formula is extremely thick due to containing lannolin. This can be hard to get used to as the opening on the applicator is pretty big. It just takes some adjusting! But overall I could not recommend this product enough. Its well worth the money!!

reviews.headline: Disappointed
reviews.comments: I'm a lanolips lover through and through, but I've got a beef to pick. The product is amazing yes and yet I'm getting less and less of it. I'm pretty sure I paid for more air in my newest tube than I did actual product. For the price it's a bit ridiculous. Do with this info what you will.

reviews.headline: Amazing for dry lips!
reviews.comments: I love how nourishing this feels! A little sticky as expected but great scent/mild flavor and very hydrating. I have chronically dry lips and this works wonders. Apply at night and in the morning your lips will be soft and luscious! I will be repurchasing!

reviews.headline: OH MY GOSHHHH
reviews.comments: yall, I had really never heard of this stuff and I stumbled upon it looking at the black Friday deals and I'm so glad I did. This stuff is really so amazing. And I'm so glad that I purchased it. It's literally some moisturizing on the lips and I'm literally in love. I will continue purchasing this forever!!! the coconut one. I thought would have a nice coconut sand. I'm a little disappointed. It doesn't but still it's really amazing.

reviews.headline: Lanolips Coconutter
reviews.comments: The tube is not sealed, the tube is less than half full. I have not tried this, since, it is only half full.  I use the original Lanolips that is sealed.  I believe the tube is underfilled at the factory 10/30/24.

reviews.headline: Best Lanolips Scent
reviews.comments: This scent is my favorite! Its not overpowering & smells like fresh coconut. The formula is great too, very thick & moisturizing

reviews.headline: Using regularly for 5yrs+
reviews.comments: I've been using this regularly since I discovered it over 5yrs ago and I haven't looked back! It's the best overnight lip moisturizer I've found. It keeps my lips pillow soft and moisturized even during winters. No spf so I do have to use something different during day and because this is too thick for under lipstick. This stuff is really my bedtime lip moisturizer and what I use after my weekly lip scrub. Also if any of my family members get peeling lips it's this stuff to the rescue! My daughter's peeling dry lips were better after just 1 night of use! I definitely recommend this and the version with coconut oil seems to work the best.

reviews.headline: Moisturizing
reviews.comments: This is nice and moisturizing. I do have to rub it in with my finger as it is thick like a vaseline consistency. However, I do not have to continuously reapply. Smells good too.

reviews.headline: Awesome!
reviews.comments: I was looking for a good moisturizing balm is this is perfect!! I love it

reviews.headline: Disgusting Coconut Smell
reviews.comments: it was just OK, maybe just slightly better then Vaseline & Cerave Healing Ointment. but the coconut fragrance is just so gross. i don't like coconut taste anyway, but this is even worse.

reviews.headline: Great product!
reviews.comments: Whenever i got this & opened it there was a huge air bubble & after that there was half the tube but honestly i think it was just mine

reviews.headline: works really well!
reviews.comments: It worka really well for my super dry chapped lips. I'm on acutane so my lips have been very dry lately and it really helps!

reviews.headline: works really well!
reviews.comments: It worka really well for my super dry chapped lips. I'm on acutane so my lips have been very dry lately and it really helps!

reviews.headline: So glad I tried this! It's the best!
reviews.comments: My new favorite! I'm recommending this to all my friends.

faceoff_positive.comments: It does smell like popcorn butter but strangely enough I really like it lol I have so many tubes of Lano. I never have chapped lips or cracked cuticles.
faceoff_positive.headline: Love the brand

faceoff_negative.comments: I usually LOVE all Lano products. I've loved them for years. My favorite is definitely the 101 and the Perfect Nude Tinted Balm. I was so stoked to try Coconutter. So when it was available at Ulta I jumped on it and bought it. But I ended up returning it a week later because of the smell. I know everyone in the reviews says buttered popcorn, but to me, it smells like Greek yogurt. Very milky, but not in a good way. In the "left yogurt out in the sun" kind of way.  Nothing like coconut milk or any "holiday" I've ever smelled, so I have no idea what they were thinking when they cooked up this scent. So the only reason it gets 3 stars is for the original lanolin and the packaging. I wanted to love this....but ew. Stick with the original fruities or the 101.
faceoff_negative.headline: Love Lano, but this smells nothing like coconut
